snippet: Manuscripts from a Persian part of the Muslim empire in the 11th century, unveiled at the National Library of Israel, shed new details about the life of a little understood Jewish society.
abstract: Batch of 1,000-year-old manuscripts reportedly found in cave in northern Afghanistan has revealed previously unknown details about cultural, economic and religious life of thriving but little understood Jewish society in Persian part of Muslim empire of 11th century; texts are part of trove of hundreds of documents discovered in cave, and are now on display at National Library of Israel.
lead_paragraph: Manuscripts from a Persian part of the Muslim empire in the 11th century, unveiled at the National Library of Israel, shed new details about the life of a little understood Jewish society.

headline.seo: Documents Illuminate Jewish Life in Ancient Muslim Empire
headline.main: Illuminating Jewish Life in a Muslim Empire
headline.print_headline: Illuminating Jewish Life in a Muslim Empire
